New Records: Fakhar Zaman completed his 11th ODI hundred, and first in a World Cup, with a six and a single off Mitchell Santner
Key Match Events: Fakhar Zaman smashed four sixes and as many boundaries in his 39-ball fifty
Rachin Ravindra smashed his third ton of the World Cup while a fit-again Kane Williamson made up for lost time with a 95
Ravindra stitched together a 180-run partnership with captain Williamson
Pre-Game Insights: Babar’s decision to bowl first after winning the toss had raised some eyebrows
Pakistan and New Zealand both have eight points and remain in contention for semifinal spots with a match each left to play in the group stage
Post-Match Reflections: Babar was in good spirits after the match
They not only need to win that but also hope New Zealand lose to Sri Lanka on Thursday in Bengaluru at this same venue or the match is hit by rain
Miscellaneous Highlights: Earlier, Rachin Ravindra smashed his third ton of the World Cup while a fit-again Kane Williamson made up for lost time with a 95
Pakistan now have eight points from as many games with their last match against England in Kolkata on November 11
Others: The ground wasn’t big enough for Fakhar, and he played an exceptional knock
